name: Altitude
primary_source: SRTM: CGIAR-CSI, reference: Jarvis, A., H.I. Reuter, A. Nelson, E. Guevara, 2008, Hole-filled SRTM for the globe Version 4, available from the CGIAR-CSI SRTM 90m Database (http://srtm.csi.cgiar.org). GTOPO30: url: https://lta.cr.usgs.gov/GTOPO30

name: Annual mean temperature
primary_source: Weather station data from multiple sources, see Hijmans, R.J., S.E. Cameron, J.L. Parra, P.G. Jones and A. Jarvis, 2005. Very high resolution interpolated climate surfaces for global land areas. International Journal of Climatology 25: 1965-1978.

name: Mean diurnal temperature range

primary_source: Weather station data from multiple sources, see Hijmans, R.J., S.E. Cameron, J.L. Parra, P.G. Jones and A. Jarvis, 2005. Very high resolution interpolated climate surfaces for global land areas. International Journal of Climatology 25: 1965-1978.

name: Isothermality

primary_source: Weather station data from multiple sources, see Hijmans, R.J., S.E. Cameron, J.L. Parra, P.G. Jones and A. Jarvis, 2005. Very high resolution interpolated climate surfaces for global land areas. International Journal of Climatology 25: 1965-1978.

name: Temperature seasonality

name: Calcite (mean)
description: Calcite concentration indicates the mean concentration of calcite (CaCO3) in oceans.
primary_source: Reference: (Feldman & McClain 2010) URL: http://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/

name: Chlorophyll A (maximum)
description: Chlorophyll A concentration indicates the concentration of photosynthetic pigment chlorophyll A (the most common “green” chlorophyll) in oceans. Please note that in shallow water these values may reflect any kind of autotrophic biomass.
primary_source: Reference: (Feldman & McClain 2010) URL: http://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/

name: Chlorophyll A (mean)
description: Chlorophyll A concentration indicates the concentration of photosynthetic pigment chlorophyll A (the most common “green” chlorophyll) in oceans. Please note that in shallow water these values may reflect any kind of autotrophic biomass.
primary_source: Reference: (Feldman & McClain 2010) URL: http://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/

name: Chlorophyll A (minimum)
description: Chlorophyll A concentration indicates the concentration of photosynthetic pigment chlorophyll A (the most common “green” chlorophyll) in oceans. Please note that in shallow water these values may reflect any kind of autotrophic biomass.
primary_source: Reference: (Feldman & McClain 2010) URL: http://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/

name: Chlorophyll A (range)
description: Chlorophyll A concentration indicates the concentration of photosynthetic pigment chlorophyll A (the most common “green” chlorophyll) in oceans. Please note that in shallow water these values may reflect any kind of autotrophic biomass.
primary_source: Reference: (Feldman & McClain 2010) URL: http://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/

name: Cloud fraction (maximum)
description: Cloud fraction indicates how much of the earth is covered by clouds. A bilinear interpolation was used to convert the data from 6 arcminutes to 5 arcminutes.
primary_source: Reference: (NASA 2010) URL: http://neo.sci.gsfc.nasa.gov/Search.html

name: Cloud fraction (mean)
description: Cloud fraction indicates how much of the earth is covered by clouds.
primary_source: Reference: (NASA 2010) URL: http://neo.sci.gsfc.nasa.gov/Search.html

name: Cloud fraction (minimum)
description: Cloud fraction indicates how much of the earth is covered by clouds.
primary_source: Reference: (NASA 2010) URL: http://neo.sci.gsfc.nasa.gov/Search.html

name: Diffuse attenuation coefficient at 490 nm (maximum)
description: The diffuse attenuation coefficient is an indicator of water clarity. It expresses how deeply visible light in the blue to the green region of the spectrum penetrates in to the water column.
primary_source: Reference: (Feldman & McClain 2010) URL: http://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/

name: Diffuse attenuation coefficient at 490 nm (mean)
description: The diffuse attenuation coefficient is an indicator of water clarity. It expresses how deeply visible light in the blue to the green region of the spectrum penetrates in to the water column.
primary_source: Reference: (Feldman & McClain 2010) URL: http://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/

name: Diffuse attenuation coefficient at 490 nm (minimum)
description: The diffuse attenuation coefficient is an indicator of water clarity. It expresses how deeply visible light in the blue to the green region of the spectrum penetrates in to the water column.
primary_source: Reference: (Feldman & McClain 2010) URL: http://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/

name: Dissolved oxygen
primary_source: World Ocean Database (2009) Reference: (Boyer et al. 2009) URL: http://www.nodc.noaa.gov/

name: Nitrate
description: This layer contains both [NO3] and [NO3+NO2] data. By this we mean chemically reactive dissolved inorganic nitrate and nitrate or nitrite. (It is important to note that data reported as [NO3] in the WOD09 should be used with caution because it is difficult to verify that the [NO3] (nitrate) data are [NO3+NO2] or [NO3]. (Boyer et al. 2009))
primary_source: World Ocean Database (2009) Reference: (Boyer et al. 2009) URL: http://www.nodc.noaa.gov/

name: Photosynthetically available radiation (maximum)
description: Photosynthetically Available Radiation (PAR) indicates the quantum energy flux from the Sun (in the spectral range 400-700 nm) reaching the ocean surface.
primary_source: Reference: (Feldman & McClain 2010) URL: http://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/

name: Photosynthetically available radiation (mean)
description: Photosynthetically Available Radiation (PAR) indicates the quantum energy flux from the Sun (in the spectral range 400-700 nm) reaching the ocean surface.
primary_source: Reference: (Feldman & McClain 2010) URL: http://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/

name: pH
description: Measure of acidity in the ocean.
primary_source: World Ocean Database (2009) Reference: (Boyer et al. 2009) URL: http://www.nodc.noaa.gov/

name: Phosphate
description: Reactive ortho-phosphate concentration [HPO4^-2] in the ocean.
primary_source: World Ocean Database (2009) Reference: (Boyer et al. 2009) URL: http://www.nodc.noaa.gov/

name: Salinity
description: Salinity indicates the dissolved salt content in the ocean.
primary_source: World Ocean Database (2009) Reference: (Boyer et al. 2009) URL: http://www.nodc.noaa.gov/

name: Silicate
description: This variable indicates the concentration of silicate or ortho-silicic acid [Si(OH)4] in the ocean
primary_source: World Ocean Database (2009) Reference: (Boyer et al. 2009) URL: http://www.nodc.noaa.gov/

name: Sea surface temperature (maximum)
description: Sea surface temperature is the temperature of the water at the ocean surface. This parameter indicates the temperature of the topmost meter of the ocean water column.
primary_source: Reference: (Feldman & McClain 2010) URL: http://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/

name: Sea surface temperature (mean)
description: Sea surface temperature is the temperature of the water at the ocean surface. This parameter indicates the temperature of the topmost meter of the ocean water column.
primary_source: Reference: (Feldman & McClain 2010) URL: http://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/

name: Sea surface temperature (minimum)
description: Sea surface temperature is the temperature of the water at the ocean surface. This parameter indicates the temperature of the topmost meter of the ocean water column.
primary_source: Reference: (Feldman & McClain 2010) URL: http://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/

name: Sea surface temperature (range)
description: Sea surface temperature is the temperature of the water at the ocean surface. This parameter indicates the temperature of the topmost meter of the ocean water column.
primary_source: Reference: (Feldman & McClain 2010) URL: http://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/

name: Bathymetry (minimum)
primary_source: GEBCO URL: http://gebco.net EMODnet Bathymetry URL: http://www.emodnet-bathymetry.eu/

name: Bathymetry (maximum)
primary_source: GEBCO URL: http://gebco.net EMODnet Bathymetry URL: http://www.emodnet-bathymetry.eu/

name: Bathymetry (mean)
primary_source: GEBCO URL: http://gebco.net EMODnet Bathymetry URL: http://www.emodnet-bathymetry.eu/

name: Bathymetry
primary_source: SRTM30_PLUS V6.0 reference: Becker et al. 2009 URL: http://topex.ucsd.edu/WWW_html/srtm30_plus.html

name: East/West aspect
primary_source: SRTM30_PLUS V6.0 reference: Becker et al. 2009 URL: http://topex.ucsd.edu/WWW_html/srtm30_plus.html

name: North/South Aspect
primary_source: SRTM30_PLUS V6.0 reference: Becker et al. 2009 URL: http://topex.ucsd.edu/WWW_html/srtm30_plus.html

name: Plan curvature
description: Plan curvature is the curvature in the direction perpendicular to the maximum slope and indicates whether flow across a surface would diverge (positive values) or converge (negative values).
primary_source: SRTM30_PLUS V6.0 reference: Becker et al. 2009 URL: http://topex.ucsd.edu/WWW_html/srtm30_plus.html

name: Profile curvature
description: Profile curvature is the curvature in the direction parallel to the maximum slope and indicates whether flow across a surface would accelerate (positive values) or decelerate (negative values).
primary_source: SRTM30_PLUS V6.0 reference: Becker et al. 2009 URL: http://topex.ucsd.edu/WWW_html/srtm30_plus.html

name: Distance to shore
primary_source: GSHHS v2.1 reference:Wessel and Smith 1996 URL:http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/mgg/shorelines/gshhs.html

name: Bathymetric slope
description: Bathymetric slope was measured in degrees ranging from 0º (flat surface) to 90º (vertical slope).
primary_source: SRTM30_PLUS V6.0 reference: Becker et al. 2009 URL: http://topex.ucsd.edu/WWW_html/srtm30_plus.html

name: Concavity
description: Concavity is the second derivative of the bathymetry layer (or the slope of the slope) and represents whether a raster cell is on a hill (negative values) or in a valley (positive values).
primary_source: SRTM30_PLUS V6.0 reference: Becker et al. 2009 URL: http://topex.ucsd.edu/WWW_html/srtm30_plus.html

name: Sea surface temperature (annual mean)
description: Satellite measures of sea surface temperature (SST) were obtained at a 2.5 arc-minute resolution (approximately 4 km²) from Aqua-MODIS 4-micron nighttime SST Level 3 standard mapped image products, downloaded from NASA's Ocean Color website (http://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/).
primary_source: Reference: (Feldman & McClain 2010) URL: http://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/
